summary: This document is an email chain between prosecutors and defense attorneys in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, discussing the preparation and filing of joint proposed jury questionnaires and a letter estimating trial length. It reveals logistical disputes over evidence production and coordination for the upcoming trial.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Partner at Haddon, Morgan & Foreman, P.C., representing Ghislaine Maxwell. She is corresponding with prosecutors about jury selection materials and trial logistics.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Government attorney (likely AUSA) corresponding with defense about filing joint documents related to jury selection and trial length estimation.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney from the Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim, part of Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team. She is sending draft jury questionnaires and voir dire questions.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Defense attorney cc'd on emails regarding jury questionnaire preparation.

persons.name: Ann
persons.context: Mentioned as the recipient of a FedEx delivery containing a hard drive from the prosecution to the defense.

persons.name: Chris
persons.context: Mentioned as having received a hard drive by picking it up in person from the prosecution.

persons.name: Bobbi
persons.context: Mentioned as having received a hard drive by picking it up in person from the prosecution (likely a different person from attorney Bobbi Sternheim).

connections.description: Prosecutor and defense attorney negotiating over joint court filings regarding jury selection and trial logistics.
Both are defense attorneys on Ghislaine Maxwell's legal team, collaborating on jury questionnaire preparation.
Both are defense attorneys cc'd on team communications regarding jury selection materials.
Prosecutor corresponding with defense attorney about draft jury questionnaires and filing deadlines.

events.title: Evidence Production to Defense
events.description: The prosecution produced a hard drive containing witness and exhibit lists to the defense via FedEx overnight delivery.

events.title: Filing of Joint Trial Length Letter
events.description: Planned filing of a joint letter to the court estimating the length of the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

events.title: Production of Witness and Exhibit Lists
events.description: The prosecution produced their witness list and exhibit list to the defense.

locations: Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim
keyFacts: The email chain shows coordination and disputes between prosecution and defense in the Ghislaine Maxwell case regarding jury selection procedures.
The defense complained about not receiving a hard drive with evidence (witness and exhibit lists) from the prosecution in a timely manner, impacting their ability to estimate trial length.
The parties were working under a court order to file a joint letter estimating the trial length, with disagreements on the content.
The defense proposed a more robust jury questionnaire than the prosecution, indicating different approaches to jury vetting.
Multiple redacted email addresses and names (shown as placeholders like '< >') appear throughout, indicating standard redactions in released documents.
